snippet: Julius Peppers, Clay Matthews, James Harrison and Mike Neal have declined to participate after a news report linked them to performance-enhancing drugs....
abstract: NFL has threatened Pittsburgh Steelers linebacker James Harrison, Green Bay Packers linebackers Clay Matthews and Julius Peppers and free agent Mike Neal with indefinite suspension because they have not cooperated with investigators looking into report linking them to performance-enhancing drugs; if implemented, suspensions would represent large expansion of commissioner's powers to punish players.
lead_paragraph: Julius Peppers, Clay Matthews, James Harrison and Mike Neal have declined to participate after a news report linked them to performance-enhancing drugs.

headline.main: N.F.L. Threatens to Suspend Four Players for Not Cooperating With Steroid Investigation
headline.print_headline: Football; N.F.L. Is Threatening to Suspend Four Players Over a Drug Inquiry
